result.execSummary:
The defendant John J McMickle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge 
Incarceration and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
Sentence credit of 428 days were granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Metro Drug. Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered and all prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy.  Inform agent of all prescriptions.

No Contact with Karissa R. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight Time. STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion.

Defendant John J McMickle in court, in custody, with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files read-in list.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Coun t#1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

8 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 428 days)
  -  4 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  4 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  4 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed AND all valid prescriptions are to be filled at the same pharmacy.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Karissa R. 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

BUY MONEY:  $40.00 to Metro Drug Unit  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  6 Months Jail (straight time) - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant John J McMickle in court, in custody, with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Fragoso states they he has reached a resolution with the state and requests plea and sentence date on Tuesday, 1/12/16.  court grants request.  Court cancels jury trial.  Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John J McMickle in court, in custody, with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for motion in limine.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements regarding motion in limine.  State makes statements regarding their position on issues referred to by Attorney Fragoso.  Detective Jeff Kopatich is sworn-in and testifies on behalf of the state.  State's exhibit #1 marked.  Cross-examination by Attorney Fragoso.  Re-direct by the state.  Re-cross-examination by Attorney Fragoso.  Attorney Fragoso requests the state provide an offer of proof on authentication of video.  State makes statements/comments regarding this issue/request.  Court finds there is proper authentication.  Attorney Fragoso requests that officer not be allowed to testify as to contents on video.  State responds.  Attorney Fragoso makes additional statements.  Court finds that testimony from officer as a lay witness is relevent and will allow it.  Court denies request by the state to provide audio to the defense with C.I.'s voice redacted.  Jury status and jury trial remain on.
Jury trial - 12 person at 01-12-2016 08:30 am
Jury status hearing at 01-07-2016 09:30 am
Motion hearing at 01-04-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant John J McMickle in court, in custody, with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for jury status.  Parties state they are still ready to proceed to trial on 11/17/15.  Court addresses motions in limine.  State makes statements.   Attorney Fragoso makes statements.  Court adjourns jury trial due to other case proceeding to jury on the same day with speedy trial demand.  Court adjourns.  Court sets separate motion hearing date prior to jury and jury status date.  Attorney Fragoso requests speedy trial.  Bail remains as fixed.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Updated witness list, filed by the State.
Defendant's additional motions in limine and request for a pre-trial evidentiary hearing. Filed by Atty Fragoso.

Defendant John J McMickle in court, in custody, with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for motion in limine.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements regarding motion in limine.  State makes statements/responses to Attorney Fragoso's statements.  State states they do not plan on playing the video or audio at trial at this time.  Court finds Attorney Fragoso's motions not an issue based on the state's statements of not intending to play video/audio.  Court addresses bail motion filed by Attorney Fragoso.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements regarding his request for bond to be amended to a signature bond.  State objects to any bail reduction/modification.  Court denies bail motion.  Bail remains as fixed.  Previous court dates set remain on.
